description:
Job Summary

We are looking for a reliable, experienced Dispatcher to help create trucking routes that keep costs down but meet customer scheduling needs. The Dispatcher will be responsible for using the latest routing software to establish daily trucking routes that make required stops outlined in customer contracts. The successful candidate for this position needs to adjust to last-minute changes and work with drivers to schedule emergency pick-up or delivery for new or established clients when necessary.

Essential Functions:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Develop delivery routes and maintain contact with drivers throughout the day
  • Collaborate with management to modify daily routes to accommodate the needs of customers
  • Monitor driver activities – (via Fleetlocate / Spireon system in order to keep customers updated on the progress of container extraction, delivery, and/or in-gate.)
  • Cultivate strong relationships with drivers and customers to reduce the stress that comes with last-minute schedule changes
  • Monitor any sudden route changes or road construction issues and work with drivers to establish new routes for timely deliveries
  • Updating/ data entry of Trinium (TMS) with accessorial (Terminal WT, Split terminations, Stop offs, etc.)
  • Troubleshoot problems at terminals and communicate with customers to ensure timely extraction of units
  • Maintaining a good working relationship with the drivers (driver retention)
  • Identify and process hazardous loads, assuring that all appropriate documents needed to conduct the move are submitted
  • Managing and tracking multiple customers and their containers
  • Provide daily status updates to customers
  • Coordinate and communicate pick up and deliveries with dispatchers, outside vendors, terminals, Warehouse Operations, and customers
  • Proper timekeeping and dispatching drivers to meet terminal appointments
  • Properly performing data entry on LCL and TL work orders / Delivery Orders
  • Checking loose freight availability
  • Troubleshooting issues appointment, pier pass, refusing empties, etc
  • Other related duties as assigned

Required Skills/Abilities:

  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule
  • Strong knowledge of the roadways throughout the immediate area
  • Ability to work in a team environment in high-pressure situations
  • Strong written and oral communication skills are essential
  • Knowledge of the Trinium system (preferred)
  • 2-3 years of logistics industry experience
  • At least 1 year of port dispatching experience
  • 2-3 years of LTL experience

AAP/EEO Statement: Quik Pick Express, LLC, LLC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, disability, sexual and gender orientation, genetic information or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.

This commitment extends to all aspects of Quik Pick Express' employment practices including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, promoting, transferring, compensation, benefits, training, leaves of absence, termination, and other terms and conditions of employment.
